intro: Tieghemopanax weinmanniae, commonly known as the golden sterculia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by woody fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
